revised_title: Applications of Optical Double Resonance in Spectroscopy
tldr: The article discusses new techniques in optical and infrared spectroscopy, specifically optical double resonance with laser-induced fluorescence detection. The technique simplifies complex spectra, resolves hyperfine structure, and determines Stark or Zeeman splittings. The author explores various applications and level schemes, highlighting the advantages of using a second laser to probe population redistribution induced by the pump laser.
